intro: Gouania leptostachya var. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited gouania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically lobed and have a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by distinctive, elongated, woody fruits. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
